result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements to be taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in ful wold result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
No contact with Reynaldo G. or codefendant Jeremiah Armstrong.

superMiscConds.notes: Be given job and vocational training.  Seek and maintain employment. Obtain GED.

No contact with Reynaldo G. or codefendant Jeremiah Armstrong.
No controlled substances or alcohol,.

Anger management counseling. Parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Cout advised defendnt that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2
State Subpoena
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed; copy provided to defendant.
/frome defendant to the Court, filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Eric Robinson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Eric Robinson in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appearedon behalf of James C. Griffin  for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 1.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 1 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNT 02:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  The 10/06/14 jury trial date is vacated.
Defense counsel did not appear as required at 8:30 a.m.  Court passed case to 1:30 p.m.

State's Witness List, received and filed with:
 - State's Motion in Limine.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Eric Robinson not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held; defense counsel advised the Court that he received a new offer and requested a plea date.  Trial date remains as calendared until defendant should enter a plea, as this case is a speedy trial.  Case is continued for projected guilty plea before Branch 20 on 9/30/14 at 8:30 a.m.   Court retained file.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Eric Robinson not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared on behalf of James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a trial date.  The following motion schedule has been set:  movant must file by 9/02/14; response due by 9/12/14; reply due by 9/17/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists must be filed on or before the final pretrial date and all alibi notices must be filed per statute.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by telephone, defendant Eric Robinson not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in trial in Branch 15; requested another date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Robinson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Eric Robinson in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Robinson in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Eric Robinson in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendants request for new counsel heard.  Motion to withdraw granted.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING & BAIL REVIEW HEARING  commencing MAY 5, 2014 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1724  (34 Pages).

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Eric Robinson not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING AND BAIL REVIEW  (34 pages) commencing MAY 5, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Eric Robinson not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Eric Robinson in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of Bridget Krause for attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Eric Robinson in custody.  Lucy Kronflrost for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Matte-MPD Officer, Matthew Retzlaff-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Reynaldo G or 3510 N 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI
